channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Poor road markings, 5th October
item.description:
The road was surfaced and road markings applied today. The road markings have been applied so thin that the tarmac can be seen below. The thickness of material used is not in accordance with the British standard. This applies to all road markings not limited to the double yellow lines. The poor application will impact the longevity of the road markings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hermitage Street, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle leaking Diesel/oil, 5th October
item.description:
Vehicle that is untaxed and used daily is leaking excessive amounts of oil/diesel onto the road. Making it hazardous for animals and children that play in the area. It is used regularly in the Cheltenham area by GrassScape company in Cheltenham "www.GrassScape.co.uk. Vehicle is outside the St Pauls Hub side of the walk, in the area of numbers 15,16 St Pauls Walk. Vehicle Reg: DK08 BGV, Mitsubishi Fuso supposedly in White but is painted Grey.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, St Paul's Walk, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 5th October
item.description:
THINK TWICE before clicking links or attachments. Dear Sir or Madam, I write as a Director of Belbec Properties Ltd, the owners of Homelands Commercial Centre, which is situated along the side of Gotherington Lane, Bishops Cleeve, GL52 8PX. As I am sure you are aware, at present major highway works are being carried out to Gotherington Lane, which we believe to include resurfacing, kerbing etc. Unfortunately, during these works substantial damage has been caused to our planting works, which were completed as part of our planning approval (20/00089/FUL Phase 1B East Site). It was a planning requirement that a hedge was to be re-introduced along the roadside grass verge and this work was carried out last autumn, which was the earliest we could obtain the correct plants. This is as per the attached photo (‘gotherington planting.jpg’) and invoice, from our contractor. As far as we were aware the plants were becoming established, and our obligations had been met. Unfortunately, during a visit to the area last week, it became apparent that your contractors have almost entirely destroyed most of this planting, whilst carrying out the works. It would seem as though there has been little or no regard for the plants at all, which is obviously a huge waste of our time and money, as well as disappointing environmentally. Please see the pictures and video attached. This damage has been caused through no fault of our own, and therefore we are looking to you, or your contractors, to rectify this situation. I look forward to hearing from you at your earliest convenience, as to how this can done. Yours Faithfully Georgina Lobo
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 5th October
item.description:
signage originally stated traffic calming (tractor on triangle sign) and now there is only the pole that held the sign. no sign is now causing a situation of vehicles dangerously stopping to try and locate turning. breaking hard.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 5th October
item.description:
Drivers constantly park on the white road markings on the bend and the yellow zigzags outside of the school. Is there a way to make the road markings more prominent and perhaps some road signs?
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 5th October
item.description:
Hi, There was a fatal road traffic collision on the A4019, Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham, at the junction with Brook Road (the KFC side of the road). It took place last night (03/10/23) at about 1943 hours. I am trying to see if you would be able to conduct a sequence check on the traffic lights at the junction, please? We would need to send an officer to witness the checks taking place. Obviously, this is something that we would like to get arranged and carried out as soon as possible. Please could you let me know if and when this could be carried out? I am hoping that it isn’t a massive task, but please let me know if it is going to cause major issues. Regards, Nick GIMBERT PC 2880 Specialist Operations Gloucestershire Constabulary Incident 0420-031023
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 5th October
item.description:
Non-Illuminated bollards and signs SignThe sign is illegible Sign When coming from Cheltenham the road is restricted to temp 30mph limit, signs at the entry to the road at Golden valley roundabout. if you are travelling from Churchdown the speed limit sign at the M5 over bridge is showing roadworks end and a 50 mph speed limit towards Cheltenham, thus showing 2 different speed limits on the same stretch of road. I also noticed this yesterday as well. As there are speed cameras in operation on this road it will lead to people being prosecuted due to wrong signage.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path doesn't match map problem, 5th October
item.description:
Hi, I am so sorry to bother you with this problem but I need to query about my responsibility to cut the hedge at the back of my garden. I have a lovely hedge at the very end of my garden with a fence behind it. There is a path at the back of my fence that goes to several houses at the back of our house. Originally some of the land at the bottom of our garden and my neighbours to the right and left also sold parts of their gardens to build these houses around 30 years ago now (before we moved here in 2017) and judging by the rights of way map the path is actually split by the houses and is their individual boundary. A neighbour at the back is asking that I cut the overhanging branches at the back as it’s my responsibility. My ex partner did this a few times for her as he has a family garden and forestry business and was able to bring a truck back, do our own hedge and would politely do that for her (mostly because she always cornered him) but we are no longer together and so I would have to pay to have this done. She seems understanding that it may not be my boundary when I said that but I want to know officially. I understand that if it was a right of way and public path I may be responsible for cutting it but as I said, I believe their path is private and should be maintained by the individual homes at the back, much like they would have to for broken paving slabs etc. I don’t want to fall out with this neighbour and hate conflict but I also don’t have the time or money to take on something that may not be my responsibility and with 2 small children and a full time job I really don’t want to take on anything else to manage. I have attached two pictures from the council website. The first is the map and the below has markers to show which house we are. You can see the green is my hedge and the yellow is their path. Thank you so much for any advice you can give. Tilly Hughes
Report on FixMyStreet
